column91: The Red Hat decision regarding source code availability for derivative distributions has had a moderate impact on our infrastructure planning for 2024.    On the one hand, we are concerned about the potential for fragmentation and incompatibility between different derivative distributions. This could make it more difficult to manage our infrastructure and deploy applications.    On the other hand, we are also excited about the potential for innovation that the Red Hat decision could bring. We believe that having access to the source code for derivative distributions will allow us to customize them to meet our specific needs and to develop new and innovative solutions.    Overall, we believe that the Red Hat decision is a positive development for the open source community. However, we are still assessing the full impact of the decision on our infrastructure planning.    We are now evaluating a wider range of derivative distributions, as we no longer have to rely on Red Hat Enterprise Linux as the only source of enterprise-grade Linux.  We are developing new tools and processes for managing and deploying derivative distributions.  We are working with other organizations to develop standards and best practices for using derivative distributions in enterprise environments.
